com.github.methylene.sym

Class Cycles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Cycles

  • public final class Cycles
extends Object

    An operation that shuffles arrays and lists.

    This implementation is based on cyclic decomposition and will sometimes use less memory than an equivalent Permutation. In some cases it can be faster when applied to a list or array, and it can optionally be applied in a destructive manner, see the clobber and unclobber methods.

    Applying it to a single index is O(n) whereas Permutation does this in constant time. For this reason, LookupList does not use this implementation internally.

    See Also:
    Permutation.toCycles()

      • signature

        public int signature()
        Calculate the signature of this permutation.
        Returns:
        1 if this permutation can be written as an even number of transpositions, -1 otherwise
